comments.content: agreed. the broadcast address is used for addressing all the nodes in the network at the same time. the network address is only used for identification.

discussion.content: /27 gives you 32 total hosts. 10.1.2.23 is in the IP range of 10.1.2.0-10.1.2.31. Broadcast ID is 10.1.2.31. E is correct
/27 got 32 hosts, need a CIDR table in exam to do this, great question to have on here, prepare on this site is excellent

questions.question_text: Which of the following technologies relies on circuit switching?

discussion.content: PPPoE is circuit switching. MPLS is label switching.
Because PPPoE is used with DSL connections over DSL lines, it relies on circuit switching. given answer is correct
Isn't the answer supposed to MPLS (Multi Protocol Label Switching)??? I do NOT see how the answer is PPPoE....Help from someone who can explain this please???

questions.question_text: The security department is looking to install a new IP-based camera. Plugging the camera into the available Ethernet jack does not power on the camera. Upon further investigation, the cable tests fine, and it does provide power to a VoIP phone. Which of the following is MOST likely causing the issue?

choices.A: The brown pair UTP has a short.

discussion.content: Kind of tricky. Most ip-based camera's would work fine with 802.af power. But given the other available options, B is correct. It can't be D because the questions demonstrates that a VoIP phone works fine, so the switchport is up
the real exam has a IP camera and POE+ questions....understand the concept guys
af and i think at are poe standards

questions.question_text: Which of the following IEEE standards explains the characteristics of how PoE should operate in a switched network?

discussion.content: A collision domain is a network segment connected by a shared medium or through repeaters where simultaneous data transmissions collide with one another. ... A network collision occurs when more than one device attempts to send a packet on a network segment at the same time.
i believe A is the best answer .

Here are the definitions for Broadcast Domain and Collision Domain.

Broadcast Domain: A broadcast domain refers to the set of all devices on a network segment that hear all the broadcasts sent on that segment.

Collision Domain: The term collision domain is an Ethernet term that refers to a particular network scenario wherein one device sends a packet out on a network segment and thereby forces every other device on that same physical network segment to pay attention to it.

choices.C: It provides multiple collision domains on one switchport
choices.A: It segments broadcast domains in the network infrastructure
choices.D: It provides multiple broadcast domains within a single collision domain
choices.B: It provides a faster port to all servers
